DataElement.preferredName: Patient Autoimmune Disease Active Or Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the eligibility critieria for enrollment into a clinical trial regarding active autoimmune disease or a history of autoimmune disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Autoimmune Disease Active Or Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them._Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Autoimmune Disease Active Or Personal Medical History Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A condition in which the body recognizes its own tissues as foreign and directs an immune response against them.:Exerting influence or producing an effect; taking part in an activity.:An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.:A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A disorder resulting from loss of function or tissue destruction of an organ or multiple organs, arising from humoral or cellular immune responses of the individual to his own tissue constituents. It may be systemic (e.g., systemic lupus erythematosus), or organ specific, (e.g., thyroiditis).
Exerting influence or producing an effect.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have active auto
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including chronic prolonged systemic corticosteroids (defined as corticosteroid use of duration one month or greater)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including systemic corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient with autoimmune disease requiring systemic corticosteroid treatment (and previously ineligible to receive systemic immunotherapies for melanoma) not require more than 20mg of daily dose methylprednisone or its equivalent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active, known, or suspected autoimmune disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease, a history of known or suspected autoimmune disease or a history of a syndrome requiring systemic corticosteroids (greater than 10 mg daily of prednisone equivalent) except for the treatment of malignancy with the exception of: Isolated vitiligo; resolved childhood atopy; history of a positive ANA titer without associated symptoms or history of symptoms of an autoimmune disorder; Controlled thyroid disorders; Type I diabetes mellitus: Psoriasis, Sjögren's syndrome, and arthropathies not requiring systemic treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have history or evidence of active autoimmune disease (e.g., pneumonitis, glomerulonephritis, vasculitis, or other); or history of active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment (i.e., use of corticosteroids, immunosuppressive drugs or biological agents used for treatment of autoimmune diseases) within 2 months of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history or evidence of active autoimmune disease (e.g., pneumonitis, glomerulonephritis, vasculitis, or other); or history of active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment (i.e., use of corticosteroids, immunosuppressive drugs or biological agents used for treatment of autoimmune diseases) within 2 months of enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active autoimmune disease that has required systemic treatment in the past 2 years (i.e., with use of disease modifying agents, corticosteroids, or immunosuppressive drugs)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active or prior documented autoimmune disease within the past 2 years?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active or prior documented autoimmune or inflammatory disorders (including inflammatory bowel disease, diverticulitis (with the exception of diverticulosis), sarcoidosis syndrome, or other serious GI chronic conditions associated with diarrhea; systemic lupus erythematosus; Wegener syndrome [granulomatosis with polyangiitis]; Graves' disease; rheumatoid arthritis; hypophysitis; uveitis; sarcoidosis syndrome, etc.) within 3 years prior to the start of treatment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have an active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including high dose systemic corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune conditions or is on chronic immunosuppression due to underlying autoimmune condition?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of autoimmune disease as specified in Section 3.4.5 of the protocol?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have active autoimmune disease or history of autoimmune disease that might recur, which may affect vital organ function or require immune suppressive treatment including systemic corticosteroids?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 15
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of autoimmune disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 14
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of autoimmune disease (such as autoimmune thyroid disease or inflammatory bowel disease) that has required systemic treatment within 2 years prior to treatment initiation?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 16
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have an active, known or suspected autoimmune disease which may affect vital organ function or has/may require systemic immunosuppressive therapy for management?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 17
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has an autoimmune disease that is active or might recur and affect vital organ function, has the study PI been consulted regarding eligibility?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 18
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have currently active or uncontrolled autoimmune disease?
